comments.commentBody:
"What intensified the alarm at the Obama White House was a campaign of cyberattacks on state electoral systems in September, which led the administration to deliver a public accusation against the Russians in October."

You don't break into electoral systems for any reason but to try to rig election results. I doubt the Russians gave up trying in September 2016.
And all of Trump's media bashing is an attempt at "preemptive innoculation". He's betting that a discredited press will somehow protect him from the truth once the borscht hits the fan.

Unfortunately for Donald Trump and his administration the staffers, former staffers, journalists, intelligence community and mice in the White House who are leaking and gathering  information are more organized, intellectually gifted, prepared, relentless, and informed. The Trump Administration is composed of greedy self serving old and really old white guys who got an opportunity to run our country through the jolly good luck of voter suppression, Putin's hand on the scale, millennials/Bernie backers trashing Democrat's solidarity and that blasted letter from Comey.  They lack the energy, connectedness, basic smarts and experience to defend themselves and their own sneaky behavior.  They are nearly completely exposed.  They are too weak and stressed to perform their jobs in the government and too dithering to protect themselves from this investigation. Trump is tied to the tracks and the train of this investigation is moving closer and faster.

So, the people who were supposedly upset that Trump said Russia should keep releasing emails think it is okay that the outgoing president may have plotted or is still plotting against the current president. They think it is okay that shadow U.S. agents are making their own law? And people are scared of Trump?

Not that we even know there is any evidence. If there was, wouldn't these shadow agents have leaked it in order to sabotage Trump's election chances? Given that and the state of the media I have trouble believing this.

And what now - if there is truth to it - does Pres. Obama publicly state that those hiding "evidence" should turn it over? If this is true, and he was involved, then he with Trump will be reviled. If there is no real evidence but Obama is involved with a shadow gov't, he will be reviled alone. Not by partisans on his side, of course, but by most people.

If there's evidence against Trump, let's hear it. I didn't vote for him and if it is real, there should be consequences. Of course, the irony is that all these anti-Trump people would be losing a president who is showing he is far more moderate than advertised and would be getting a truly staunch conservative stepping into the role.

The Republicans are drunk with power, in not investigating obvious Russian & Trump collusion in the past Presidential election. They have a chance to right the ship and plug the holes before it is too late. History has taught us, the truth always comes out. It may take a month or 4 years, but it always comes out.
Blood in the water. NYT keep up the good work!

replies.commentBody:
The Putin-Assange leaks of stolen DNC-related emails and fake news from the RT disinformation campaign(s) did a lot to suppress American voter turnout.

Russia is going to pay for its acts of war against the US and its similar, ongoing aggression against European nations such as France and Germany (just to nane the two biggest Russian targets.)

You might want to resugn your post in the 30-Ruble Army, and try to get into Slovenia, Estonia, or Latvia before the political and economic retaliations begin, or at least get your savings out of the country...like your fearless leaders continue to do!
With cyber warfare, attacking is much easier than defending. An attacker has to break through in just one place, while a defender has to defend everywhere.

comments.commentBody:
In my opinion, the far greater threat to American Democracy is low voter turnout, voter apathy and a general lack of regard for civic engagement. Russian hacking of our political infrastructure is distressing but only successful due to do few people voting.

When it comes to the subject of hacking, I find it ironic (and infuriating) that America, with her advanced cyber warfare capabilities (stuxnet) would be so vulnerable to hacking.

replies.commentBody: And, let's remember, it's always the cover-up that gets you in the end.

By November 2018, the disaster, corruption and coverups that this administration will wreak upon the American people will be irreversible. Remember that the 9/11 attack occurred over six months after Bush took office: the chaos and disorganization that the Trumpian regime has unleashed already, while denouncing intelligence, conducting confidential security decisions openly from Mar-a-Lago's patio, the Flynn debacle, colluding with the Kremlin, gutting the State Department and more, has left this country far, far more vulnerable than the Bush administration ever did. And per Bannon, this administration longs for a dystopian scenario. We do not have until 2018. We don't even have until the end of this year. We must act quickly and investigate this infested administration now.

You must ask yourself.....why is it taking so long?

Well it takes time for Democrats to create the "facts" and then get each other on board with all the lies.

comments.commentBody: The truth will come out. It's only a matter of time. If there were "no there there" then the White House would act now to get this matter out of the way. Dragging it out not only looks bad, but brings Congress closer and closer to November 2018. Nothing is going to get done without addressing the there there. And most important of all, if there is there there, swift and dramatic action is needed to secure democracy.

replies.commentBody: Amazing to see how fast the left has turned on Russia. First time in history, as far as I can recall. The 1980's called, I guess.

I'm a Trump supporter and I would say that if it's PROVEN (not merely allegations, innuendo, etc.) that Trump took money from the Russians he's got to go - no question there!

However, my sense is that all of this Russia nonsense is the last gasp of a losing ideology - Leftism - as it desperately tries to prevent Donald Trump from undoing everything that Barack Obama stood for during his time in office, beginning with Obamacare, and ending with his love fest with the late Fidel Castro in Havana.

How wrong you is. Republicans have carried the anti-russian banner - 'patriotizing'  darned respectable Democratic Presidents into doing things they might otherwise not have done. What's different is that Democratic mall trotters have awaken to the 'danger' President Obama developed over his last term.   But they didn't actually start believing until Trump nosed into first place.

comments.commentBody:
It is mind boggling how quickly Republicans shifted from distrust of Russia and awareness that Putin does not have our best interests at heart in his actions, to shrugging off the proven disruption of our election that struck at the very heart of our democracy, by affecting at least to some degree the outcome of the election of POTUS.

Can you imagine if the situation was reversed and it had been Trump that Putin was out to undermine, and then Hillary Clinton had won? Republicans would be exploding with investigations of election tampering, and Trump would be shouting from the rooftops rigged, rigged!

And what about " a campaign of cyberattacks on state electoral systems in September." What was that? Are we to presume that the Russians stopped this particular form of attack after September?
Did they not only hack Democratic emails, make contact with Trump associates, but also change the election results by attacking state electoral systems at their weakest points? With all the information we now know. this type of interference does not seem unlikely, even if difficult to investigate or resolve.

replies.commentBody:
We know that both Flynn and Sessions lied about contact with the Russians prior to trump being president.
If that doesn't bother or concern you, fine, but it does concern me and many others. Especially given mr trump's oddly soft stance on Putin.
Nobody wants a war with Russia, but I also prefer our president not be in debt to them.

comments.commentBody:
Nothing but innuendo after sitting on the dossier since last summer. The dossier was such garbage that no legit news outlet would report on it. The only news here is the lengths Obama went to undermine the Trump administration. His entire Russian report before he left office was one big memo telling everybody to use better passwords.

At this point, the accusations should be accompanied with proof or trashed. The intelligence community tracked and recorded every call and has zero of merit.

In the darkness of night, we will eventually see the stars. Be patient and pray a brave patriot comes forth with the information. But remember, beware those who come to you when you should be looking for them. The mistake of Watergate was the Post relying on spoon fed information from an F.B.I. Deputy Director in a darkened garage.

No one is explaining this: Trump was advised two weeks before the media discovered Flynn's Russian connections. Did Flynn, then a known potential Russian blackmail target, continue to have access to classified intelligence information, never mind before that? Why would a commander in chief tolerate the security risk for TWO WEEKS? Answer: Trump should have felt Flynn went behind his back, and fired him immediately, unless....None of those answers falls very far short of election tampering by cooperating/conspiring with a foreign (and hostile to US interests) nation in influencing the outcome to their (both parties') liking. So the questions Trump will avoid is what did he know, and when did he know it? Not much changes, including the outcome. After Trump goes on the record on those issues (as far as I know, he hasn't been asked and given an unequivocal answer) it will start to unravel. Anyone who's read Shakespeare already knows that. Restriction of the press' ability to ask questions is an impairment of its freedom of speech and a denial of equal protection. It fits a fascist agenda. If it looks, acts, and talks like a fascist, guess what? It's not a duck.
And we all know that when we see the so called President's tax returns, we'll find bodies (conflicts) galore. It's like watching a slow motion going over a cliff.
comments.userDisplayName: Peter Lamberto (please use Pine Mtn Pete instead)

comments.commentBody:
I keep going back to Flynn hedging on content of his conversations with the Rusian ambassador. If it was all on the up and up, why lie about it.

And, if there was no collusion between Trump campaign staffers and Russian entities, why won't Trump WH champion full and open investigations. Then we can all move on.

replies.commentBody:
Obama was leaving intelligence behind because, with Trump's statements all during the campaign about his BFF, Putin, Obama,s administration didn't trust the incoming administration to show , or worse, get rid of the intel.

Obama didn't give the oder, the people who look into such things spread out the information.

You project Trump's behavior onto Obama. Narcissistic Personality was never, in 8 years, used in reference to Obama, it has been used many times for over 20 years, in relation to Trump.

I am so surprised that people who may not have liked Obama ( fair enough) are willing to disregard the many many alarms that are going off. I do not understand but I accept that Trump supporters think that these concerns are unfounded and simply attempts to impede the new government. So I will just ask why, since it has been the accepted practice for years, and since it would put to rest so much of the suspicion that Trump supporters resent, does the man not simply release his tax returns?

Everyone else has. It is completely reasonable to conclude that he has something to hide by not revealing them.
And now he's back.  Hope the republicans get to run against his policies again.

comments.commentBody: All I see here is Obama trying to leave a time bomb behind because the American People had the audacity to reject his policies. The narcissistic jerk is just a gift that keeps on giving.

It was in one of his farewell interviews that President Obama, referring to Trumps denial of climate change, said that you can only deny/dispute reality for so long.  Reality will eventually assert itself and wash away the lies.  The brilliance of the Obama administration strategy was to strew the evidence over the widest possible array of investigative agencies.  It was clear when the rules governing the NSA's release of transcripts was significantly loosened in the last months of the Obama presidency that something ominous was in the works.  It may take a year or longer for the truth to come to light, but it will come to light.  That's now a certainty thanks to President Obama, the NY Times, the Guardian and a host of intelligence agencies on both sides of the Atlantic ocean.

To the spineless GOP, appoint a Special Prosecutor NOW to investigate Trump and his band of Russian-grovelers or plan to go up in smoke come election time. Your constituents are already fed up with your bait-and-switch tactics on Obama Care, all based on smoke and mirrors...

This is a bottomless rabbit hole, and either Trump is knee-deep in these treasonous actions or he's about the most gullible human being on earth.

replies.commentBody: I know! Stop with all these confusing stories and allegations. Get to the point: Has something illegal/treasonous transpired, or not? Make up your minds!

comments.commentBody: I want the truth! I can handle the truth!

Unless the U.S. Intelligence Agencies were covering for each other.  Remember Nixon.  But we did not have the U.S. Department of Homeland Security back then either.  Make a list of new agencies that Donald Trump is working with now and those that previous administrations worked with.  I know that not all information is required reading material for the President and now President Trump is avoiding contact with them.  It could be that he wants to be the one in charge of handling classified information.  There is a reason for his empire and it could be how he was elected.  Ask the (IRS) Internal Revenue Service.
I've read constantly about DNC hacks but what about the possible snooping "devices " discovered in a sweep and then reported by MotherJones at DNC.

replies.commentBody: Except Watergate did not involve collusion between a candidate and a foreign government. It is one thing to cheat ...a whole other to welcome your enemy's enemy to help you win.

comments.commentBody: This is Watergate 2017. Come on journalists from everywhere. Jump on this and DO NOT STOP until every stinking detail is unearthed. Too many comparisons between Nixon and Trump to be ignored. Republicans will do squat in this current situation. Journalists, have at it. Time for you people to have at it. This is not "fake news". Journalists are MY only hope at this point. Get um!

replies.commentBody: Bunch of bunk.  Why would Obama go to all that trouble when he knew an incompetent administration would be coming in.  They knew the Repubs would control both houses of Congress and Trump in the WH.  By the way, Obama didn't give the order, it was his administration  Intel that was rattled and wanted to make sure this was not swept under the rug.  You are projecting what you would think Trump would do if the shoe was on the other foot.  Obama didn't have any big scandals in 8 years.  Trump has had a scandal a week .

From the Administration that swore the Benghazi attack was caused by a "video" and swore over and over again that you could "keep your doctor" comes the latest Russian hacking narrative.

Normally, an objective media would pick up on the fact that the alleged "contacts" Sessions had with the Russian ambassador were in a group chat at a social event and then in his office, like the hundreds of other visitor meetings he has. These meetings were not only NOT clandestine, they weren't even remotely private.

But that would be the job of an objective media.

comments.commentBody: "Former American officials say they had two aims: to ensure that such meddling isn’t duplicated in future American or European elections, and to leave a clear trail of intelligence for government investigators."  So in other words, after 8 years of pretending Russian efforts to destabilize the West and create mayhem elsewhere were not real threats, the Administration in its last hours decided to warn everyone about the Russian threat?  That three top Times reporters have the audacity to make this claim without pointing out the partisan hackery of Team Obama is ludicrous.  Here's how the sentence should have been written: "Former American officials say they had two aims: to deligitimize Trump's surprise victory over the President's preferred candidate, and to pretend that Russian meddling was the real reason for the electorate's rejection of President Obama's legacy.  They also wanted to leave a clear trail of intelligence for government investigators, so that the early days of the Trump Administration would be paralyzed".  Now that would have been news that would have been fit to print.

replies.commentBody: The DNC this was awesome. We held them accountable. That's how you handle misconduct. This is different. These people colluded with a foreign enemy power then lied about it. That is Treason plain and simple. This is another Watergate now....

That is exactly what millions are thinking now .It wasn't russian interference
that swayed the vote.It was Podesta's Emails at the DNC with DWS .
They themselves blew it .Although we should all be grateful for an ounce of truth
here and there . Clinton herself , not withstanding her husband should take a good hard look at the completely underhanded attempts to manipulate votes
and going so far as to being compliant in voter fraud .Bill, showing up at a polling place ,keeping the folks from getting near the door for an hour ? c'mon .So much more .Thank you John Podesta .Russia ? nope .

"Are people who complain about Russian hacking saying that the voters should not know the truth about the inner workings of the DNC?"

No. That's done.
The American people would like to know the truth about how Russia is connected to the inner workings of the recent Republican campaign - and now the inner workings of the current administration.

Let's clear the air, and do it soon.

comments.commentBody: If Trump's team conspired with the Russians to hack the emails, and if Trump himself was involved, that's a crime and would be an impeachable offense. But if it was just the Russians, what's the complaint? The DMC emails were authentic. Are people who complain about Russian hacking saying that the voters should not know the truth about the inner workings of the DNC?
Wow. The administration of Donald Trump is an unconstitutional heap.

It is incredibly heartbreaking to think our new president and his staff are so interested in their new, exalted positions and getting the programs they support realized, that they may have been willing to - well, let's just say it - commit treason, rather than protect our precious democracy as the beacon of light in the world that it is. When did so many become so small and so self-interested? Do we have so few in government now willing to choose country above self? Thank goodness for those brave patriots who anticipated harm and did what they could to protect the proof.

We citizens who love our country must unite; we must not tolerate such bold-faced self-interest that it becomes treason, and we must be willing to do whatever it takes to save our beloved country.
